image.altText: Man stands at a podium giving a speech

props.synopsis: Australian Security Intelligence Organisation director general Mike Burgess has provided a few more details about a former politician accused of helping an international spy ring.

title.children: 'We confronted them': Ex-politician accused of spying was recruited during term in parliament

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese cross paths in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: While the Dunkley by-election did nothing to change the electoral map, it offers insights into how Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton will battle the next federal election.

title.children: This by-election changed nothing but it could ultimately change everything

image.altText: Police escort protesters out of the Mardi Gras parade.

props.synopsis: Nine pro-Palestinian protesters were arrested on Oxford Street as thousands of revellers took part in Mardi Gras festivities on Saturday, which this year also honoured Jesse Baird and Luke Davies.

title.children: Protesters arrested at Sydney Mardi Gras as thousands turn out to celebrate

image.altText: The Brisbane Broncos' Pat Carrigan attempts to tackle the Sydney Roosters' Brandon Smith.

props.synopsis: The 2024 NRL season starts in Las Vegas with the Manly Sea Eagles beating South Sydney Rabbitohs 36-24, before the Brisbane Broncos take on the Sydney Roosters at the site of the Super Bowl. Follow live.

title.children: Ezra Mam makes formal allegation of racial comment from Roosters opponent in NRL Vegas opener

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 70' Ezra Mam makes "a formal complaint that's racial in nature" against Spencer Leniu
JOEY! MANU!! He's pulled off the best try assist you might ever see

image.altText: A split shot of a woman in  a dress and in running gear.

props.synopsis: A "top priority" investigation, numerous police interviews and a supportive community effort have been features of a search in the month since Ballarat mum Samantha Murphy disappeared.

title.children: No new leads and a tight lid on protracted investigation — what we know about Samantha Murphy's disappearance

image.altText: A close up image of an SA Police car.

props.synopsis: A 73-year-old motorcyclist has died after a crash in South Australia's Flinders Ranges, with early reports suggesting the man collided with a kangaroo and a tree.

title.children: Man dies after motorcycle crash involving kangaroo in Flinders Ranges

image.altText: Vehicles on a beach

props.synopsis: A WA shire is considering the possibility of charging 4WD drivers to access a local beach because of the increasing cost to ratepayers caused by overcrowding.

title.children: This beach south of Perth could be the first in the state to charge for vehicle access

image.altText: JobSeeker queue with red graph showing unemployment claims increase.

props.synopsis: Is it possible to take politics out of economic stimulus programs, to everyone's benefit, asks Gareth Hutchens.

title.children: If we could take politics out of economic stimulus programs, what would happen?

image.altText: A graphic showing the faces of a woman with dark curly hair and an older man white white hair, with missing in the background.

props.synopsis: Ric Blum had a history of multiple aliases, fraud and a pattern of exploiting vulnerable women, an inquest has heard.

title.children: Marion Barter believed she was in a relationship with Ric Blum before she disappeared. Who is he?

image.altText: five colourful vapes standing on a black-coloured counter

props.synopsis: In recent years, there has been a significant rise in vapers under the age of 25 — and so too has the demand for services to help kick the habit.

title.children: Children presenting with 'significant symptoms of withdrawal' from vaping

image.altText: Kylie MInogued in a bejewlled, mirrored dress on the media wall holding her award

props.synopsis: Check out the key moments and a full winner's list from Britain's night of nights for pop music.

title.children: Kylie Minogue named global icon at BRIT awards and Raye smashes single-year win record

image.altText: A close-up picture of a man handing over a set of house keys to a woman.

props.synopsis: It might make sense financially, but there are potential emotional pitfalls in accepting support from family to get into the property market.

title.children: The hidden costs of borrowing from the 'Bank of Mum and Dad'

image.altText: Alex de Minaur plays a forehand against Casper Ruud in Mexico Open.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur continues his solid start to 2024, winning the Acapulco ATP 500 title for a second consecutive year via a clinical victory over three-time major finalist Casper Ruud.

title.children: De Minaur successfully defends Acapulco title with straight-sets win in final

image.altText: Nathan Lyon celebrates

props.synopsis: Nathan Lyon gets flipped around and rips through the New Zealand line-up, while Rachin Ravindra shows he has plenty to learn in his fledgling Test career. Here are the five quick hits from the fourth day of the first Test at Basin Reserve.

title.children: Five quick hits — Lyon stars, Green prevails and NZ star learns a lesson in Australia's 172-run victory

image.altText: ambulance and cars parked on side of street

props.synopsis: Emergency workers worked through the night to retrieve the body of a woman in her 20s who fell to her death on a hike in the Lamington National Park.

title.children: Woman falls to death at popular waterfall in Gold Coast national park

image.altText: Emily Cosson concentating in playing pinball

props.synopsis: At 10, Emily Cosson was the only female at pinball competitions. Then she started beating the grown men. Now, she's part of a trend turning old-school cool again.

title.children: Digital natives resurgence in the popular arcade game has seen world rankings taken over by under 21-year-olds

image.altText: LeBron James gestures with his left hand after becoming the first NBA player to reach 40,000 points.

props.synopsis: James adds another milestone to his lengthy list of achievements, as the NBA great looks to put his all-time scoring record further out of reach.

title.children: LeBron James becomes first player to score 40,000 points in NBA

image.altText: Young smiling girl wears melon-coloured shirt, pink and black baseball cap, jeans, sits with dog in a helicopter cockpit.

props.synopsis: Mustering stock, navigating the vast landscapes of outback Australia and directing "ground crew'" from above is all in a day's work for Natasha "Tash" Greenshields. But not too long ago, she thought it was out of her reach.

title.children: Tash always wanted to be a helicopter musterer, but a flippant comment nearly derailed that dream

image.altText: A moth with thick green stripes across its wings and a brown and black tip.

props.synopsis: Citizen scientist Dion Maple has a special interest in moths. His favourite is the crayon emerald but it's another rare species that is proving tantalisingly elusive. He unwittingly photographed it years ago and hasn't been able to find it since.

title.children: Rare moths among citizen scientist's 15k nature observations

image.altText: Gough Whitlam in grey suit, blue striped tie, pours soil into Indigenous man Vincent Lingiari who wears blue shirt, tie.

props.synopsis: Gurindji traditional owners want schoolkids and tourists to be able to walk the old fence line Vincent Lingiari and his people followed in the 60s. But they say the heritage area's condition is "really sad".

title.children: It's one of Australia's most famous photos, but the birthplace of land rights has seen better days

image.altText: A grey haired woman standing in a hospital hallway smiles.

props.synopsis: Restless with retirement, former corporate high-flyer Nesya King didn't want to "wait for God". She was drawn back to her first career — nursing — and 30 years out of the game, she returned to university to become qualified.

title.children: At 70, Neysa is embracing the start of her 'retirement career'

image.altText: A photo of a castle at night in a forest, with everything all lit up by lights.

props.synopsis: Mark and Judy Evans purchased a dilapidated tourist spot with its very own castle 30 years ago. They say its success is due to the park's 100-year history.

title.children: There's an almost 100-year-old castle in a Queensland rainforest. How did it get there?

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Oh, you're back? Something to prove after last week's effort? Let's see what you've got.

title.children: You won a trivia night once? Cute. Now it’s time to play, HARD!

image.altText: An elderly woman with medium-length grey hair sitting in front of a black piano.

props.synopsis: For more than seven decades, pianist Mary Sutcliffe regularly played at milestone events in her small country town, but demand has fallen off a cliff in recent years, with the cost of living crisis a major factor.

title.children: Mary's music used to be the soundtrack of her town's weddings and funerals but now she's rarely asked to play at them

image.altText: A young woman wearing togs sits on a log on a beach

props.synopsis: As hospitalisations from stingray encounters rise, a young woman recalls a solo snorkelling trip on north Queensland's idyllic Magnetic Island, where she had a marine encounter she will never forget.

title.children: Drew's encounter with a stingray while snorkelling was 'excruciating'. Here's what to do if you get barbed

image.altText: A person is seen in silhouette standing at the rear hatch of a plane as parachutes are seen falling from the back

props.synopsis: The United States drops 38,000 meals into Gaza and a US official says Israel has endorsed a framework for a ceasefire and hostage release deal.

title.children: US drops aid into Gaza where UN says 550,000 close to famine

image.altText: A calculator on a table with an electricity bill, phone, and pens

props.synopsis: With electricity bills still high, we've compiled a list of the energy-draining appliances that may be spiking your power bill and how to cut costs.

title.children: The six biggest energy guzzlers in your home driving up your power bill — and the best way to run them efficiently
